intro: Corydalis aurea var. pallida, commonly known as the pale yellow larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from pale yellow to white. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested or alpine environments. Its foliage consists of basal leaves with lobed margins, and it produces slender, branched stems. Corydalis aurea var. pallida is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
